Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class CurrentGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.Subject
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.CurrentGame
  • public class CurrentGame
extends Subject
    This is the main class, and it stores every information regarding the current game. It stores a list of the current Players and their stats like damage taken, weapons, etc. and the actual state of the map like the map type, which depends on the number of players and the actual position of the players in the map.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Map currentMap
      Reference to the model Map of the current game

      private int skulls
      Number of skulls in the kill shot track of the current game
      private PowerUpDeck thrashPowerUpDeck
      Reference to the model trashpowerup deck, needed to switch the thrash with the original when there are no more powerups
      private WeaponDeck weaponDeck
      Reference to the model weapon deck

        public PowerUp drawPowerUp()
        Returns:
        a randomly picked PowerUp from the current powerUp deck, if this is empty it sets the trash one as the good one

      • idToPlayer

        public Player idToPlayer​(int id)
        This method is a util method that will be used to translate the player ID in the pointer to that player will be called this way: CurrentGame.idToPlayer() so that it can be used also in other classes easily
        Parameters:
        id - is the identifier of the player which is individual for each player and can not be changed during the game
        Returns:
        a pointer to the aforementioned player

      • playerToId

        public int playerToId​(Player p)
        Parameters:
        p - player passed as parameter
        Returns:
        an integer representing the unique id of Player p

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()

      • addkills

        public void addkills​(int killerId,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> overkill)
        This method is used with multiple kills in one turn
        Parameters:
        killerId - is the id of the player who shoot
        overkill - is a list of Boolean that are true if the player gets overkilled
